citeinfo.title: Changes in Anthropogenic Influences on Streams and Rivers: Irrigation

descript.abstract: This dataset consists of two tables representing the proportion of land in irrigation. One table is for five year periods from 1969-2012 derived from U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) Census of Agriculture data, and one table is for five year periods from 2002-2012 derived from U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) data. Both tables are for Hydrologic Unit Code 10 (HUC-10) areas.
descript.purpose: These data are intended to provide a framework in which watershed-specific studies of water quality in streams and rivers may be analyzed. The focus of the data is on anthropogenic changes over time.
descript.supplinf: Two comma-separated text files are given here. Each file contains a "uniqid" field, which is the link to the data in all other datasets in this product. Each file has 15,458 rows. Two time series are given here: both represent the same metric, the proportion of the HUC-10 area in irrigation, however they are derived from different data sources. One table is based on 1969-2012 USDA Census of Agriculture county-level irrigation statistics allocated to agricultural land use pixels (Falcone and LaMotte, 2016). The other table is for three time periods from 2002-2012 USGS data, which were 250-meter (m) irrigation presence/absence based on satellite imagery, land use, and Census of Agriculture statistics (Brown and Pervez, 2014). The USGS Brown and Pervez data have higher spatial resolution and are likely to be more accurate, however both show similar mappings. For example, the correlation coefficient (r) between the data for the year 2012 from each source for the HUC-10s given here is 0.98. However, if the user's time period of analysis only goes back to 2002, it is recommended to use the USGS data. HUC-10 boundaries were obtained on January 9, 2018 from the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) National Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) at https://nrcs.app.box.com/v/huc/folder/39640323180 (National Resources Conservation Service, 2017). References: Brown, J.F. and Pervez, M.S., 2014, Merging remote sensing data and national agricultural statistics to model change in irrigated agriculture, Agricultural Systems, 127; doi:10.1016/j.agsy.2014.01.004. Falcone, J.A., and LaMotte, A.E., 2016, National 1-kilometer rasters of selected Census of Agriculture statistics allocated to land use for the time period 1950 to 2012: U.S. Geological Survey data release, https://doi.org/10.5066/F70R9MHS. National Resources Conservation Service, 2017, Watershed boundary dataset (WBD): National Resources Conservation Service, U.S. Department of Agriculture, available at https://www.nrcs.usda.gov/wps/portal/nrcs/main/national/technical/nra/geo/, accessed January 9, 2018 from https://nrcs.app.box.com/v/huc/folder/39640323180. U.S. Geological Survey, 2015, Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) Irrigated Agriculture Dataset for the United States (MIrAD-US), accessed March 15, 2018 at https://earlywarning.usgs.gov/USirrigation.

srcinfo.srccontr: HUC-10 boundaries used in data calculations.

citeinfo.title: National 1-kilometer rasters of selected Census of Agriculture statistics allocated to land use for the time period 1950 to 2012

srcinfo.srccontr: National 1-km rasters of irrigation data allocated to land use from which data were derived

citeinfo.title: MODIS Irrigated Agriculture Dataset for the United States (MIrAD-US)

srcinfo.srccontr: Source data from which 2002-2012 USGS irrigation data were derived.

procstep.procdesc: (1) Source data for the Census of Agriculture-based data (Falcone and LaMotte, 2014) were downloaded from https://www.sciencebase.gov/catalog/item/577545bfe4b07dd077c70885, from the zip file alloc1950-2012-irrigation-sqkm.zip. These were 1-km resolution rasters for five year time periods from 1950 through 2012. The data from the USGS-based MODIS data (Brown and Pervez, 2014) were downloaded from https://earlywarning.usgs.gov/USirrigation on March 15, 2018. These were 250-m rasters for the time periods 2002, 2007, and 2012. The USGS MODIS 250-m rasters were reprojected to the project Albers Equal Area projection.
(2) HUC-10 watershed proportional area of irrigated agricultural land was calculated using the zonalmean() command in ArcGIS Grid.

enttyp.enttypd: Data consist of two comma-separated text files, irrigation-CoA-1969-2012-huc10.txt, irrigation-USGS-2002-2012-huc10.txt
enttyp.enttypds: Surface Water Trends project, USGS National Water Quality Program
